intro: Ormocarpum cassioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white flowers. The plant has a creeping, mat-forming growth habit with slender, hairy stems and narrow leaves. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp that splits into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. Ormocarpum cassioides thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
